questions.instruction:
Questions 1–7
Reading Passage 1 has seven paragraphs A–G.
Choose the correct heading for each paragraph from the list of headings below.
Drag a heading from the list and drop it onto the correct paragraph's answer box on the left.
List of Headings i. Early years of Gilbert ii. What was new about his scientific research method iii. The development of chemistry iv. Questioning traditional astronomy v. Pioneers of early science vi. Professional and social recognition vii. Becoming the president of the Royal Society viii. The great works of Gilbert ix. His discovery about magnetism x. His change of focus

options.label: ii
options.text: What was new about his scientific research method

options.label: vii
options.text: Becoming the president of the Royal Society

questions.instruction:
Questions 8–10
Do the following statements agree with the information given in Reading Passage 1?

content.questionText: Gilbert is less famous than he should be.

questions.instruction:
Questions 8–10
Do the following statements agree with the information given in Reading Passage 1?

content.questionText: Gilbert was famous as a doctor before he was employed by the Queen.

questions.instruction:
Questions 8–10
Do the following statements agree with the information given in Reading Passage 1?

content.questionText: Gilbert lost faith in the medical theories of his time.
